channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9005] Improve documentation around KEEP_DELETED_CELLS, time range scans, and delete markers
item.description:
Without KEEP_DELETED_CELLS all timerange queries are broken if their range covers a delete marker.
As some internal discussions with colleagues showed, this feature is not well understand and documented.
item.summary: Improve documentation around KEEP_DELETED_CELLS, time range scans, and delete markers

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
How about this?
This seems to be a confusing topic. Any other suggestions?
Any comments? Does it explain it better? Any better suggestions?

lgtm
nit:


+  <para>By default delete markers extends back to the beginning of time. That means that <link

'extends' -> 'extend'
Only targeting 0.99 since this will go into the general documentation area on the site.
I don't know why this didn't go in, it seemed like it was done. I'll integrate this into the current state of docs and make a new patch.
Replicated Lars' patch (couldn't get it to apply automatically) and massaged the wording a bit. Please review.

I do not see my changes in the latest attached patch.

(And if I may comment on the test related changes, they seem to be a bit too specific for the HBase book ).
That's because I uploaded the wrong patch. Fixed. Please review HBASE-11317 about the changes related to unit testing.

can you add a link to http://hbase.apache.org/apidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/HColumnDescriptor.html#KEEP_DELETED_CELLS instead of the current generic link to HCD (which has no javadoc)? Pointing to it and saying it is a boolean makes it much more actionable. Bonus points if an example were provided to change it in the shell. (maybe not just here, but
Somehow I missed this feedback. New patch addresses it.
